name: Euro Truck Simulator
description: The original Euro Truck Simulator - the game which has become the classic of the genre and is still relevant today. The first truck simulation game in a European setting, with European long haul trucks! Drive freight from London to Rome to Berlin to Madrid to Prague - and many more cities - in realistic vehicles.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 2.4 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB DirectX¬Æ: 9.0c Hard Drive: 2 GB HD space Sound: Any DirectX compatible Additional: Gamepad or steering wheel recommended
recommended_requirements: Additional: Gamepad or steering wheel recommended

reviews.review_text: better than League of Legends.
Don't remove the UK from the game!

I really enjoy this game, even though people may think it's boring to keep driving back and fourth to different cities to only drop off cargoes in order to gain more money. Although there is less cities to drive to, I still enjoy it. I love the feeling to be able to drive properly, and have played 20 hours within 2 days due to being obsessed. I'm not saying the game is perfect, hell, the second game might not even be perfect (can't buy it since I have a Mac) however it still is fun.   I am quite big on graphics, and I have to admit this isn't so bad. The trucks/cars both look great and so does the interior of the trucks. You can either drive on manual or automatic which adds realism, and so does the various types of weather, time, and the rules of the road. Sound doesn't seem to be much of a problem, it has realistic car, weather, truck and engine noises.  Having to deliver more and more in order to gain more money, does take a lot of time. But this leads to the game being more addictive and actually worth it. However, if driving back and forth for a while isn't really your thing, this can become a problem, though I ensure it wont be when you actually try it out, and even better, unlock more places.   One thing that has annoyed me while driving around on here is how stupid the other drivers are. They either go the wrong way, beep at me when I am not doing anything wrong, and/or randomly brake when there was no need to which leads me into hitting them, which leads to me having to pay for hitting them. Adding pedestrians or animals would also be something which would make the game better (no I do not want to run them over)  Another thing is how the cities are extremely small, and only have up to 5-6 roads, which is bad for when you want to explore other places other than the highway. The sound is good, but not so great. It sounds like I'm driving ontop of the truck rather than inside (might be because the windows are always open for some reason) and the radio does not sound like it's actually coming out of a radio in the truck.   Honestly, I love this game even though it has some flaws which I have to live with, however those are probably fixed in ETS2. I recommend this game if you either have a older computer, have a Mac and cannot buy the second one (which is my case) or have a few cash left or is low on cash to spend it on this. An overall 6/10 from me.

Being someone who has now put nearly 40 hours in to this game, i can highly recommend this. nothing much to do but drive, i find its a great game to to 2 jorneys a day, i can reflect on my past day, this game is sort of my quite zone, put some music on and take a deep reflection on your life.  10/10, better than a psychiatrist.
very good game nice
A fun and simple Truck sim.I give it 7 out of 10.
Old gane but really cheap. My 4years old boy loves it and it is enough for me

If your looking at the Truck driving sim I will assume you already understand the basic idea.. Its about making money, delivering loads incident free and buying better trucks etc. thats the idea.. Its also about relaxing on a sunny day driving across Europe.. much cheaper than a real Euro vacation. Its allssooo about tight butt cheecks driving in low visability in crappy weather trying not to destroy your truck or kill anyone ( not really ) on your journey.. or dealing with city traffic in a big truck. There is alot to enjoy if this is your genre

Honestly, This game has made a huge impact on my life. Positive and negative. Lets start off with the positives. I got to drive to a down, and run people down on roads. I looked through the mirrors too much and crashed, but it was a very fun experience. Now the negatives. My friends don't like me anymore, my parents disowned me. But I'm a trucker, my dream.  10/10 would ruin life again

I had played Euro Truck Simulator 2 demo and really liked it. I then bought it about a month ago on sale. It was one of the best games I have ever payed money for on the computer. I was then looking at the Euro Truck Simulator 1 and decided to buy it because it was on sale for $2.50. This is also a great game. I am able to run it on high settings and not get lag. This was great considering any other game I run on high settings I am not able to play due to so much lag. If your computer can handed Euro Truck Simulator 2 on high settings then buy it. If not the buy Euro Truck Simulator 1.  I have a Dell Inspiron N5050: intel i3 2.40GHz CPU Windows 7 64bit 6 GB of ram Intel Intagaded HD 3000 graphics
game is great i think every vehicle lover should play this :D!!!!!!!!!!!

To be honest, this game is god-awful compared to SCS's Euro Truck Simulator 2 and American Truck Simulator. If you are to get, get on sale, not really worth $4.99, which I luckily got this on sale for a $1.24.
Highly Recommend Any Simulators With Trucks, Boats, And Cranes Made By Someone Like This
no migrants to run over but still there arent a y migrants good game

Euro Truck Simulator plays just similarly to many of the older SCS Software trucking titles like the Wheels of Steel series. For a cheap game it's pretty fun, just don't expect to much from the graphics, physics, or play control. In many ways it looks like a first draft of Euro Truck Simulator 2 which is a superior game in every way.
This game is actually so good
turned breaks on, couldn't turn them off, caused a massive traffic jam. 10/10

Euro Truck Simulator is very fun to play when you just want to relax. The easiest way to play is with a USB steering wheel, but it is OK with mouse and keyboard. It's a nice way to just calm down after a tough day, because you don't have to have your full focus on it. This is really nice because you can do something else while you are playing without loosing anything from it. I recomend this game, although I have heard that Euro Truck Simulator 2 is much better, so I would check that out too.

This is an amazing game! My friend introduced it to me, and i cant stop playing it! The road trips are great, and the graphics are great! If I had one suggestion/complaint, it would be that the other cars never follow the rules alot of the road. Half the time i had an aciident, the other car had rammed into me. That would be my only complaint for this game. Overall, its an amzing game, and I'm very glad to have it!
You get to drive a truck.  5.5/10
the game that began it all, this is the game that ets2 is basedon

I bought this to drive a truck from A-Z. I was not disappointed.
This is a time waster and it stole my life 10/10

I bought this game because i got so a random steam gift card and heard the second one was good. I have a mac so i can't buy the second one :(  The concept might seem simple and non-entertaining but it has a sort of feel that you cant get from other games. Once you drive across a country you get a sort of feeling of accomplishment.  The amount of detail in the game is stunning. It is a very addicting game that i cant see myself getting tired of.  This game is the kind of game you need some time for but is well worth.   Basically i would reccommend this game to anyone young or old. :D
the only reason i got this was bacause the second one wasnt for mac. But i have to say this game is pretty damn good.

Buy it when comes in a sale, but if possible buy the 2nd game as it is far more superior.

Have you ever wanted to do that in a truck that travels about as fast as a drugged tortoise? Well now you can in 'Euro Truck Simulator!' This game has redefined the Truck Simulator genre with it's amazing story and beautiful landscapes. 10 out of 10!

I'm surprised how good this game is! After you pushed yourself for hours to beat games one after another, this really puts your mind at peace.
YOU SHOULD PLAY THIS EPIC GAME OF TRUCK DRVING!!! ALTHOUGH THE GRAFICS MIGHT BE BAD, BUT THE SIMULATION MAKES UP FOR IT!!

I'm not going to make this game out to be something it isn't. Euro Truck Sim is a half-baked idea with potential.  While the premise is cool, the gameplay is surprisingly shallow. Get Euro Truck Simulator 2 instead.
Its fun but after a bit of playing it gets pretty boring AND I CANT GET A DARN REFUND

Really borning game without much content. It's driving from point A to point B. Hardly any traffic to deal with, no cops instead you just get fined once you do something wrong. Speeding tickets constantly if you get far enouhg ot buy a faster truck, also headlight violations when it's not even dark out.   Also, no time limits on the shipments, makes getting fuel and getting rest pointless, you just stop by one on your way to the drop off point.   Literally the only things you can do with money is Buy faster trucks, or buy countries so you can travel even longer. The most exciting thing that happens is when it rains. Probably one of the worst simulators I've ever played
best game and funny!!!!!!
Game pretty much requires a gamepad which is not supported by the Mac version.

First time i've seen a game that gives me problems with vehicle steering. The steering controls do not work properly. They are defaultly disenabled. I constantly have to enabled them and even when i do enable them, it doesnt register. Even though they recommend a gamepad or steering wheel (i do have a gamepad - logitech, and ps 3 controller) i cant get my gamepad controls configured because there isnt even a keystroke command assigned to for 'steering left' or 'steering right' in the first place. So all i have done this past 0.5 hour is constantly restarting the game and moving the trucks forward and backward. Sometimes the steering would randomly work with just keyboard option.  Save your money instead and get euro truck simulator 2 maybe.
Very similar to it's sequel but the trucks have aweful controls and handling.  6/15 - 'Buy the sequel'

If you're a truck driver, you should probably really reconsider your career choice.

Very chill game or when you have absolutlely nothing to do. The game requires some imagination to make it exciting though, such as believing I'm a fat gross perverted truck driver looking to peep on the female drivers. When you play it, put on some music because otherwise it is just driving around with not much happening on the road.

This game has impacted my life more than any game I've ever played. From the moment I started playing, I knew what I had to do. I only put about 20 minutes into this game before logging off and going to the local drivers testing center. I told them I wanted to get my CDL license. They asked me if I had practiced, as I would likely not be able to pass it without some practice. I told them I had played Euro Truck Simulator for 20 minutes. The lady didn't really know what I was talking about but let me take the test anyway. I passed with flying colors. Would recommend this game!

This game is not bad at all, we can see a lot of changes on Euro Truck Simulator 2.   I really like it I spent more than 2 hours playing it and I recommend you guys when you are working at this game put some music and you'll forget yourself.

Trucks. The trucks are in Europe. You get to drive goodies around.  Seriously, though, play the second one. It's much better, I think we can all agree. However, without the second one to compare this to, I'll say this is an okay game. If you're into driving trucks, or simulation games in general, or obeying traffic laws, or flipping over, you're in luck. This game is for you!

Driving, trucks, causing massive casualties, traffic jams, back and forth driving action, the simple fact that this game exists. Loki recommends this trucking game fully, for it allows him to sit at home and also live out his simple dream of being a trucker!

This game and ETS2 are the best truck driving simulators out on the internet. It takes some time to get used to. The game teached you not to just drive at top speed and ram other motorists out of your way. If you have a choice of picking any truck driving simulator game, don't pick Rig n Roll.

It's good, very buggy thou, but any way awsome at simulating, thou version 2 is better.

This game introduced me to the world of virtual trucking, and it's amazing.  This tyipe of simulation game can be hard to explain to someone who has never played a game like it. To say is a lot of towing and throwing is a big understatement. An Average play though consist of picking up cargo and driving it from A-B in one pice 'ideally'.  Runs well on my 5 year old laptop with modest radion dedicated gpu. So most new laptops with onboard gpu should be fine.  I'm very excited to play the follow up game, but I want to try my best to level up though the ranks before I do.

If you are like me, playing Euro truck simulator 2, and want to try its older version, here is an advice for you: Do not buy it! The game have great graphics for its time, but the physics suck and logic too. I love old games but this took the price.

This game is surprisingly pretty good, especially if you're bored and can't decide on a game to play. It's also pretty relazing, driving through the countryside. However, one thing that I'd like to point out, is that there is no auto-save. I was hoping there would be some kind of backup save system, but there isn't. Not to say that this is really a bad thing, but just remember to save fairly frequently. My computer just crashed, and I lost all my progress since last night, which is a total of about 7 hours... Still a highly recommended game, especially if you don't have a good enough computer for the second game, or if you're just too cheap to buy it.
A (truck) driver's dream...

Old and awesome game! I remember first time when I got this game... Really took a bit of my life away... And now when I bought it again I just thought 'ok, let's play 5 minutes and deliver one cargo!'. 6 hours and 3 cargoes later I had no regrets for buying this game! Of course, graphics could be better, but it's quite an old game and it has better graphics than some games of that time!

It may be the older version, meaning it is fairly limited in terms of truck customization and map extensiveness (somewhat limited on total locations), but if you can get past that, its highly addictive, and for those who enjoy a good driving simulator, surprisingly good fun. The low price is also a very good selling point, giving you a pretty well-done, immersive game experience, more than you'd get from just the demo for Euro Truck Simulator 2. A good stepping stone to warm up for ETS2. Overall rating: 9/10, just wish the trucks could be customized a little more.
I got it with a bundle, fun for half an hour but don't bother unless you are really into trucks (and I understand there are more modern games for that).

After playing this game for an hour I ended up playing another 5.5 hours straight as it's so fun just to drive your own truck!

Since ETS2 won't run on my PC (1 Gb RAM, AMD Radeon 1.8 Ghz and 512 Mb Video Card) I've spent some hours on this game, and after all, It's a perfect Truck Sim game. Realistic gameplay like getting a speeding ticket for going with 30 mph under a bridge or roaming free on whatever lane you want.

Back in 2008 (just after 4 days of game released) I was 8 and purchased my first game.I was played Hard Truck series on my very early childhood,this game was my first HD game and also European trucking simulator.When I first entered,I didn't believe my eyes.That interiors,that environment,was very fascinated me.All these combinations was excited me.  Now,in almost 2015,sequel of this legend Euro Truck Simulator is expanded but this game still best for me.And when I saw my game on Steam,I smiled for myself.And when the christmas discounts came over this game,Got it...  Legends never die.. Get it if you love SCS Software,get it if you love Euro Truck Simulator franchise ;)
I love the game because it is very realistic and easy to play. The only thing I have a problem with is that I wish it had more cities.
Super confusing and overwhelming when you just start it, but thats a big part of the fun. Its an awesome simulation game.
